page.title: 09A SHORT HISTORY OF CULROSS 1
page.content: Standing at the Mercat Cross in Culross and looking in every direction, one might imagine that one had been transported into a different century or that one was on a film set. In fact the town is frequently used as a film set, for the heart of Culross is as it was in the l7th century; little houses with pantile roofs and crow-step gables, half-shuttered windows, narrow cobbled streets with their "croon o'the causey", a raised path of wider, flatter stones where the rich people walked to escape the filthy gutters on either side. The only difference here is that the 'croon' is much lower today than in previous times to allow today's motor cars to escape damage underneath. The history of Culross actually goes back even further - more than a thousand years, in fact.
